bibl.idno: Papers of Jefferson Randolph Kean [manuscript] / Jefferson Randolph Kean, 1860-1950. MSS 628. The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 21, 1944

div1.p: Publishers want Kellogg to revise his book on the history of Ireland for a second printing. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 21, 1944
div1.opener:
ETHICON SUTURE LABORATORIES
Division of Johnson & Johnson
NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J.
July 21, 1944
Dear General Kean,
div1.p:
I have just returned
from a 6 weeks trip, half of this
time being spent in the Puget
Sound country in western Washington

On my return I find your
kind letter with the letter from
General Hume enclosed. This is
most interesting and I will return
it safely in a few days.

My trip was half vacation
and half business. My younger
brother, the Lt. Col., M.C. now in
England, has a beautiful log house
on the Island (Whidbey) on which
we were born. I spent two
full weeks there with my
mother, sisters and nieces
& nephews.

Many years ago I wrote
a history of the Island, now
out of print, which I find
has become a “collectors item.”
The publishers have persuaded me
to rivise it for a second edition
in 1945.

John and Robin are at Camp
and I spent Saturday and Sunday
with them this past week end
immediately on my arrival.
Give my best to Mrs Kean.

I wanted you to know I
had received both the letter from
General Hume and the one from
yourself.
